comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: www.archive.org/stream/aroundclockineur00howerich#page/14... shows a picture of the beach at Scheveningen and these same mushroom-like things -- apparently called "bath-cars."

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: digitalgallery.nypl.org/nypldigital/id?833167 catalogs them as "beach baskets" in another picture of this beach. The German term is strandkorb. See www.bartelmann.com/bildergalerie/strandkorb/index.html for lots of pictures.

comment.author: 8482419@N08
comment._content: The bath cars or beach baskets are actually beach seats. In the pictures you only see single ones. There are in fact also double ones. They are quite cosy, quiet, simply great. Picture from the front of the seat: http://www.j-p.nl/nieuws/images/rieten_strandstoel_historisch_wijk_aan_zee.jpg You can still buy them (they have evolved with cushions). Look for 'rieten strandstoel'

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: Thanks, mizzbizzi. An image search on 'rieten strandstoel' found plenty. I like www.flickr.com/photos/nationaalarchief/3586355652/
